Chapter Previous Next

class gstScene

Holds haptic scene and mediates interaction with the PHANToM and servo loop.

From header file: gstScene.h

Constants

SMOOTHING_OFF
SMOOTHING_ON
Constructors and Destructors
gstSceneConstructor.
~gstScenePerforms a recursive delete on all nodes under the root.
Functions
cleanupServoLoop Clean up the haptic simulation after an internal error.
getDoneOneLoop For internal use.
getDoneServoLoop Returns TRUE if haptics process has finished (i.
getRoot
getRoot Get root node of haptic scene graph.
getSafety Returns TRUE if safety limits are on.
getSafetyLimit Returns the currently set duty cycle limit (sec).
getSmoothing Get smoothing level of the scene.
lock Lock() a gstScene before making changes to it if the servo loop is running.
postServoLoop
preServoLoop
servoLoop For internal use.
setDoneOneLoop For internal use.
setPostServoCallback Provide a callback to be called in the servoloop thread following the last servoloop tick.
setPreServoCallback Provide a callback to be called in the servoloop thread before the first servoloop tick.
setRoot Set root node of haptic scene graph.
setSafety Turns safety on and off.
setSafetyLimit Sets the duty cycle limit in seconds that gets checked by the safety.
setServoCallback In addition to the standard Ghost servoloop activity, you can hook in your own callback function that will get called at servo rate.
setSmoothing Set smoothing level for scene.
startServoLoop Start the haptic simulation as separate process.
stopServoLoop Stop the haptic simulation.
turnForcesOff For internal use.
turnForcesOn For internal use.
unlock Call unlock() after a lock() to resume normal servo loop behavior.
updateEvents Calls the event callback for all nodes in the scene which have new events since the last call to updateEvents().
updateGraphics Calls the graphics callbacks for all nodes in the scene which have changed since the last call to updateGraphics().
